title: How to Pickle a Large Zucchini in a Bottle

steps.headline: Grow some zucchini plants in your backyard.
Clean an empty bottle.
steps.description: An old wine or vinegar bottle is ideal for this culinary trick.

steps.headline: Select a strong-looking zucchini when it first appears.
Place the baby zucchini into the neck of the bottle.
steps.description: Be very gentle as you do this, to avoid snapping off the zucchini.

steps.headline: Put the bottle back down gently in the zucchini patch.
steps.description: Tuck it under zucchini leaves to shield it from the heat of the sun.

steps.headline: Wait.
steps.description: Zucchinis grow quickly, so it shouldn't take too long. It will take about one week for the zucchini to grow under normal growing conditions, with a healthy zucchini.

steps.headline: Cut the zucchini.
steps.description: When the zucchini is almost as large as the bottle, cut it at the stalk. Bring inside for pickling.

steps.headline: Boil some vinegar in a saucepan.
steps.description: Pour slightly cooled vinegar into the bottle. Add some pickling spices and herbs to taste. Seal the bottle and store.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Bring the entire bottle to the table when serving. It is a talking piece and worth displaying to all!

text: Grow some zucchini plants in your backyard.  Clean an empty bottle. An old wine or vinegar bottle is ideal for this culinary trick. Select a strong-looking zucchini when it first appears.  Place the baby zucchini into the neck of the bottle. Be very gentle as you do this, to avoid snapping off the zucchini. Put the bottle back down gently in the zucchini patch. Tuck it under zucchini leaves to shield it from the heat of the sun. Wait. Zucchinis grow quickly, so it shouldn't take too long. It will take about one week for the zucchini to grow under normal growing conditions, with a healthy zucchini. Cut the zucchini. When the zucchini is almost as large as the bottle, cut it at the stalk. Bring inside for pickling. Boil some vinegar in a saucepan. Pour slightly cooled vinegar into the bottle. Add some pickling spices and herbs to taste. Seal the bottle and store. Serve. Bring the entire bottle to the table when serving. It is a talking piece and worth displaying to all!
